column4: so im setting up samba, and the workgroup  is the same as my windows machines but i cant see the folder i have shared from my windows machine, i can log in to samba from the desktop that is serving it....
so to make sure I understand, you can see the folder being shared on the machine sharing it, but you can't see it across the network on another machine?
dutchtux: what usb devices are you using?
viata yes
are the two machines on the same subnet?
viata .... yes, and the same workgroup....
Ok.  So in the menu bar at the top, when you select "connect to server," and type the machine name of the server followed by the folder, what happens?  (in this format: \\machine-name\folder-name)
viata on wich machine
scottg489: And VNC still fails to connect?
do that on the non-hosting machine
viata it can't connect.... here is my smb.conf
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/m4770d371
you dont.
scottg489: is it running in the background?  I think the command is "ps aux | grep vncserver"
in the menu, when you click on "network" underneath the different home folders (on the non server), do you see any other machines in your network workgroup, including the one you want to connect to?
viata i cant see the linux machine from the windows machine thats why im here.
I'm sorry, I got confused.  I thought it was linux to linux :)
viata i see.
viata should i enable wins server.
scottg489: I found this quick tutorial online for what you're looking for.  see if it helps any, because I'm not really sure what else. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=197964
scottg489: nalfeshnee is correct, you can always try another type of vnc server
I'm not sure, to be honest.  I haven't networked windows to Ubuntu machines and vica versa before.  I'm sorry.
